column4: Hello anyone out there willing to help me troubleshoot an issue I'm having?  I migrated from Ubuntu to Xubuntu for the faster speeds and Now an application that was previously set to autostart, is still automatically starting and I want it to stop. Any ideas?
I Started out with Ubuntu hardy Heron if that helps anyone
in the XFCE Settings manager there is an entry for "Sessions and Startup" But it does not give any application-specific listings just some check boxes for login/logoff prefs mainly
look in ~/.config/autostart there must be an entry for that application, try deleting that and see
no, no don't do that! might mess up ur system!
u could try the xubuntu forums or irc channel, i seem to have struck a dead end unfortunately!
can u tell me what exactly that application does?
i need to have it start after I assemble my raid array which is not automatcially assembling itself.  I use MDADM to manage it
now this might sound extreme, but is it possible for u to uninstall transmission, reboot the machine and then install it again, might work
check this (pasted from xfce wiki faq) - http://paste.ubuntu.com/145242/
your link has some good info in it too.  I am looking into this as a possible fix as well.
